Rachel Butler from Deleware; James had measles in the past; adopted mother died in the almshouse when he was an infant; Nathan is his adopted father and wants James to be placed near a city once he is "placed out" of the orphanage
illegitimate child of his father. not known if he was alive. mother is a native of New Jersey. William born in Philadelphia. no known living relatives besides his mother
this is a letter to "the managers of the shelter" that William is a good candidate for being in the orphanage. He was previously housed in The Colored Department of the House of Refuse

no relatives besides second cousins in Wilmington, DE & dead aunt Sarah Brown's husband, Cesar Brown who lived in Trenton. Samuel had small pox

Genette signed with "X"; Mary had smallpox and measles; had an Aunt that lived @ No. 40 Blackberry Ally in Philadelphia (Catherine Derrickson); had another Aunt living in Canada
has grandmother named Alice Jones

mother described as half Indian and half French, and she died in the almshouse;left in the care of Solsbury after her death; father described as mulatto; mother and father were married; child has no known relatives except grandmother in St. Louis; has had measles and whooping cough
father died in California; has uncle in NY named James Downing; aunt in the south named Maria Downing
mother is deceased; aunt Mary Jolly lives in "Whites Court between Pine, Lombard, 10th, and 22nd
has had whooping cough or measles
mother is Irishwoman "of very bad character" and father is "colored"; the signer is a guardian; father left kids "property amounting to 50 dollars"
mother is Irishwoman "of very bad character" and father is "colored"; the signer is a guardian; father left kids "property amounting to 50 dollars"
mother died of consumption, father was "poisoned"; both died in Philadelphia; has grandmother and aunt named Davis living in Lancaster; signer is grandmother

Thomas Paton is "a worthless fellow" and "deserted his family"; mother is deceased; has sister named Eliza in Lancaster; 4 uncles and 2 aunts in NY; grandmother named Pratus and one aunt in Philadelphia named Eliza Bastick

vaccinated; previously had chickenpox, measles, whooping cough, varialoid; mother is deceased, father is described as "worthless" and "not known where"; has two aunts - one named Eliza Smith in Bucks County and the other named Elizabeth who lives in the city
mother is deceased, and "father supposed to be signed over by her great aunt"
vaccinated, has had whooping cough and measles; father is deceased but mother is living, also has an uncle named Anthony Middleton, one aunt, and a grandmother
vaccinated by Dr. Taylor of Germantown
vaccinated; has an uncle named Benezet Irons who lives at 883 Ride Avenue and and aunt named Ruth White who lives at the top of the Inclined Plane

father described as a "colored man", mother described as an "Irishwoman"; she has two brothers named William and Nicodemus who are in the shelter; their guardian Perry Tillman is a waiter and caterer and lives at 14 Canaut Alley

vaccinated, has had whooping cough, scarlet fever, measles; grandchild of Joseph Mason (deceased) and Cynthia B. Mason; admission paper has a letter from Cynthia on the back detailing more information about the children's family

vaccinated, has had whooping cough, scarlet fever, measles; grandchild of Joseph Mason (deceased) and Cynthia B. Mason; admission paper has a letter from Cynthia on the back detailing more information about the children's family
grandson of Joseph Mason of Washington City
vaccinated; father and mother are both deceased; sister Julia Cooper lives on Joy St.

father left mother about 3 years ago, mother now lives in the city; has one aunt named Elizabeth Williams who lives in the city and 3 uncles - one in California, one in Delaware, and the other "folloes the sea"; also has 2 brothers named Robert and William; has been vaccinated and has had "no disease common to children"
father is deceased, mother lives in the city; has a grandmother named Ellen Williams, an uncle named James Williams who lives on Paschall Alley, and 3 aunts, 2 of whom live in the city; vaccinated
vaccinated, but has not had any common childhood diseases
has had smallpox and measles

vaccinated and has had whooping cough; has a grandmother named Amy Gale who is unable to care for him, and a father who is living but "not correct in his habits"
has been in the care of his grandmother since his mother passed last fall; his father left to "go to sea" when he was a week old and has not been heard from since; has two aunts on his mother's side

parents died about three years ago; vaccinated and has had whooping cough and measles; has a cousin named Hetty Lewis, a widow who lives in the city and has an interest in the child

parents are both deceased, father was a clergyman and died a few months before admission to the ACCO; one sister named Mary Eliza, 15yrs and 8mo old and one brother named John Syles Driver, 12yrs and 10mo old; vaccinated and has had whooping cough, measles, and scarlet fever

parents are both deceased, father was a clergyman and died a few months before admission to the ACCO; one sister named Mary Eliza, 15yrs and 8mo old and one brother named John Syles Driver, 12yrs and 10mo old; vaccinated and has had whooping cough

father, John Addison, is in "delicate health", he is the father of 7 children and his wife left him due to him being "unsuitable to have charge of her"; the child has had measles and whooping cough and has supposedly been vaccinated, but will be cheked because there is some doubt

vaccinated and has had whooping cough and measles; father is deceased but mother is still living (mother was formerly enslaved[?])
father died in the almshouse in 1858, mother is in very feeble health; not known to have had any of  the common childhood diseases

mother is known to be deceased and is decscribed as a "degraded intemperate woman living in Bush Row", father supposedly died in the almshouse some time ago; when found, the child had been living in a "wretched home with an unlawful stepfather", and it was decided that no one had legal claim over the child
mother is deceased; father is alive but went to the south in search of work; the child is vaccinated and has had smallpox, whooping cough, and measles (doubtful)
signatory and witness are members of the Board of Guardians of the Poor
examined by J Neba M.D. and found to be in good health
parents were both enslaved - when their enslaver died Dennis and his mother were set free, Dennis's father had passed some time before
has had measles and whooping cough; father has been dead for some time, mother died at the time she was taken to the shelter
father has been deceased for a while, mother is in the last stage of consumption and cannot care for her children; has had smallpox
father has been deceased for a while, mother is in the last stage of consumption and cannot care for her children; has not had any common childhood diseases
has had whooping cough; grandparents are named Philip and Catharine Manhoff and live "below Milford Delaware"
note reads "This child is not to be bound out but returned to the Caldwell family when called for"
mother lives in West Chester, PA

father has been deceased for about 4 years, his name is unknown; after his father's death, his mother went to New York to live but has not been heard from for two years, she is assumed to be dead. Mary Dickson does not have any relation to the child but took care of him for 3 years. (note written by Mary Wood)
father is deceased, mother deserted him and left him in the care of Levi Johnson
she was signed over to the shelter by her aunt, Sarah Johnson; her father was killed on the railroad and her mother died of consumption
mother has been deceased for 2 years and father has 8 children and cannot care for them all - Sarah Ann and Mailliard are the youngest. both children have had whooping cough
